feed.title: Gilmore Girls Blog
feed.subtitle: Let's talk Gilmore Girls. Whether you've just discovered the show or you're on your bazillionth re-watch, we understand. You NEED to talk about it. With a village who understands. We've got you. Welcome to Gilmore Girls Blog.

entry.title: What’s your favourite Gilmore Girls scene?

link.title: What’s your favourite Gilmore Girls scene?

entry.summary: My chain of thoughts was interrupted today by a colleague asking me what I was thinking about. I’d been away with the fairies, a dappy smile on my face. ”Favourite pizza”, I replied - my go-to - but actually I was replaying Gilmore Girls scenes in my head.

entry.title: The Great Loves of Gilmore Girls : Lorelai and… snow

link.title: The Great Loves of Gilmore Girls : Lorelai and… snow

entry.summary: She glides downstairs in a red long-sleeved tee and pulls the sash window open, hangs her head out and breathes in the chilly air. It’s a moment of care-free innocent enjoyment and Lauren, with her hair in bunches, is so cute it’s almost annoying (‘how can you be so adorably cherubic?!’ I want to shout, pinching her porcelain cheeks, tears streaming down mine). You kinda get the feeling Lauren Graham does this kind of thing for real while Peter Krause rolls his eyes; she’s effortless.

entry.title: Would Rory Gilmore have a Kindle?

link.title: Would Rory Gilmore have a Kindle?

entry.summary: There’s that episode where she’s berating her backpack for being too miniscule for her library of books. It’s bursting at the seams. On top of her school books, she’s packed a bus book (Milay’s biography), a lunch book (Vidal’s essays), a Faulkner novel and Eudora Welty’s short stories, for whichever mood might take her.

entry.title: Oh there you are, finally.
entry.summary: Right now I’m at the end of season three. My sweet spot. Jess is visiting his dad in Santa Monica. Lorelai’s reading Rory’s yearbook and discovered that Rory is valedictorian but didn’t tell her. She’s so proud you can see her eyes start to prickle but she doesn’t make a scene because Rory’s so busy revising and doesn’t have time. I on the other hand, am a heaving, blubbering mess.
